intro: Cayaponia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
